meanings.definition: A deed transferring one person's interest in a property to another.
meanings.sent1: The quitclaim stated that the ownership of the land was transferred to the new owner.
meanings.sent2: She signed the quitclaim to give up her rights to the house.
meanings.sent3: The quitclaim document was so official, it made me feel like a real estate agent!
meanings.sent4: His quitclaim of the property felt like passing a torch to the new owner.
meanings.sent5: The quitclaim was like a key that unlocked the door to property ownership.

meanings.definition: To release or relinquish one's claim or interest in something.
meanings.sent1: He decided to quitclaim his share of the business to his partner.
meanings.sent2: She had to quitclaim her rights to the inheritance.
meanings.sent3: I told him to quitclaim his spot in line, but he refused to budge!
meanings.sent4: Her decision to quitclaim the project surprised everyone.
meanings.sent5: The company had to quitclaim the project due to financial constraints.
